data.Title: Google Declared a Monopoly in US Antitrust Case
data.Description: A US federal judge has ruled that Google is a monopoly and has acted as one to maintain its dominance in the search market. The ruling could have significant implications for the company, potentially leading to limitations on its business practices or even a breakup.

data.Title: Apple Refuses to Replace Google with Bing, Even for "the Whole Company"
data.Description: Despite Microsoft's alleged offers, including giving Bing away for free, Apple has steadfastly refused to replace Google as the default search engine on its Safari browser.  An Apple VP stated that Bing's quality and revenue generation simply don't compare to Google's.

data.Title: Google Search Console Introduces "Recommendations"
data.Description: Google Search Console is rolling out a new experimental feature called "Recommendations." This feature aims to provide website owners with personalized SEO advice based on data gathered by Search Console, potentially simplifying the optimization process.

data.Title: Google Ads to Migrate Smart Campaigns to Performance Max
data.Description: Google Ads will be transitioning the functionality of Smart Campaigns into Performance Max campaigns over the coming months. The company claims that Performance Max offers all the benefits of Smart Campaigns and more.

data.Title: Google Business Profiles Performance Report No Longer Shows Call Data
data.Description: The Google Business Profiles performance report has stopped displaying the "call" tab, which provided statistics and data on calls originating from Google Search and Maps. This change is suspected to be related to the recent removal of the Google Business Profile call history feature.

data.Title: Google Ads Plagued by Bugs, Including Million-Dollar Credit Errors
data.Description: Google Ads has been experiencing a series of bugs, including a major reporting outage caused by ads mistakenly serving for products from other merchants.  To make matters worse, a subsequent bug led to some advertisers receiving credit notices for millions of dollars.

data.Title: Apple Maintains a Search Index of "Billions" of Websites
data.Description: Court documents from the recent Google antitrust case have revealed that Apple maintains its own web search index, encompassing "billions" of websites. The exact figure remains redacted, but the revelation highlights Apple's potential to compete in the search market.

data.Title: Google Testing New Search Features and Ad Formats
data.Description: Google is actively experimenting with several new search features, including a "you may like" label for snippets, a test sending users to the short videos tab when seeking more videos, and a new "featured options" ad format that presents listings in card layouts.
